title: Covid: Horse therapy for NHS nurse is 'magical'
description: Intensive care sister Amanda White, who lost her nephew to the virus, says the therapy "reset" her.

title: Lockdown album written by Bungay singer, 16, after cancer diagnosis
description: Pearll, who is now in remission, says she saw the spare time as an "opportunity" to record songs.

title: Belarus: A climate of fear for opposition activists
description: The BBC speaks to some of those whose lives have been changed forever by the protests in Belarus.

title: Yemen fishermen find $1.5m of ambergris in the belly of a whale
description: A lucky find in the belly of a whale has changed the lives of a group of poor Yemeni fishermen.

title: 'Gene therapy is a game changer for our son'
description: A five-month-old becomes the first person in England to get a drug with a list price of £1.79m.

title: The story of Spain’s ‘terrifying confidence’ – and how it conquered the world
description: One night of embarrassment in October 2006 convinced Spain that something had to change - sparking a momentum shift in world football.

title: Who will miss out? Southgate to cut seven for England's final Euro 2020 squad
description: England boss Gareth Southgate will announce on Tuesday who has made the final cut as he whittles his provisional 33-man squad for Euro 2020 down to 26.

title: Sinéad O'Connor: My life is actually really boring
description: "I've got to the time in life where you just want to sit and be peaceful in your garden and knit."

title: The dancer aged 106 who bans the word 'old'
description: Meet Sydney artist Eileen Kramer, who has had some of her most productive years since turning 100.

title: Extremely rare prehistoric animal carvings found for first time in Scotland
description: The first prehistoric images of their kind to be found in Scotland were discovered by chance inside a cairn.

title: A Quiet Place Part II becomes biggest pandemic-era US box office hit
description: The film becomes the biggest hit at North American box offices since the start of the pandemic.

title: Warning UK could be entering early stages of third wave
description: A scientist advising the government says there has been exponential growth in the number of new cases.

title: Pin Mill boat rescue: Diners rescued as floating restaurant gets stuck
description: The vessel's engines failed and it got lodged on mud near Pin Mill, Suffolk, with 11 people onboard.

title: France police 'neutralise' armed ex-soldier after Dordogne manhunt
description: The 29-year-old man was injured in a shoot-out with police after a 24-hour manhunt, reports say.

title: Lockyer added to Wales squad as Lawrence ruled out 24 hours after being included
description: Tom Lockyer is called into Wales' Euro 2020 squad after fellow defender James Lawrence is ruled out with injury.

title: China allows couples to have three children
description: Census results show China's population grew at its slowest pace in decades last year.

title: UK set for stronger post-Covid recovery, says OECD
description: The UK economy's post-pandemic performance will outpace other large rich nations, a new forecast says.

title: NSA spying row: Denmark accused of helping US spy on European officials
description: Denmark's secret service is accused of helping the US target politicians such as Germany's Angela Merkel.

title: HBO Max outage in US mars Mare of Easttown finale
description: Kate Winslet's drama reaches its "masterpiece" last episode, but many US viewers are made to wait.

title: NBA: LeBron James' no-look assist as LA Lakers lose to Phoenix Suns
description: LeBron James provides a no-look backward pass assist as the Los Angeles Lakers fall to a 100-92 defeat by the Phoenix Suns in the NBA play-offs.

title: Pilot distracted by passenger wanting to fly, report says
description: A pilot may have been distracted by a passenger "constantly asking to try to fly the aircraft", a report says.

title: Real Madrid 'no longer had faith in me' - Zidane
description: Zinedine Zidane says he resigned from Real Madrid because he felt the club "no longer had faith" in him.

title: Israel coalition government a threat to security, warns Netanyahu
description: The prime minister urges right-wing politicians not to join a proposed new unity government.

title: Covid: Vietnam starts mass testing as new variant emerges
description: A Covid outbreak in Ho Chi Minh City triggers new social distancing rules and mass testing.

title: Dog buried alive and left for dead
description: Passing hillwalkers heard the collie's cries and found Jake had been deliberately buried under a pile of rocks.

title: Copa America without host 13 days before start as Argentina stripped of tournament
description: The 2021 Copa America has been left without a host less than two weeks before it starts after Argentina was stripped of the tournament.

title: Folly Farm's pensioner sloths move into new retirement home
description: Tuppee, 26, and Lightcap, 36 have been well suited to a lazy lockdown, says their sloth keeper.

title: Covid: Holiday cottages to get 'year's takings over summer'
description: With "noticeable nervousness" around holidays abroad, Welsh firms look forward to a busy summer.

title: Sacked by Yorkshire, picked by England - meet Ollie Robinson
description: Pace bowler Ollie Robinson on being sacked, why his mum is nicknamed 'Richie Benaud' and how his dad beat him to an international call-up.

title: Newspaper headlines: Jabs 'ramped up' and Covid passport 'scrapped'
description: The vaccination programme and plans for Covid status certificates make the front pages of the papers.

title: Noisy appliances: How loud is your house?
description: Environmental consultancy Quiet Mark is on a mission to ensure technology is seen but barely heard.

title: Eviction ban: A million are in fear of losing their homes, charity says
description: The Joseph Rowntree Foundation says it is worried about a "wave of homelessness".
